column4: What are files without extensions and can make there extension anything you want
most are text, whats the files full path and name
it's the vegastrike launcher
try: file <file>
itll tell you what it is
e.g: file /usr/bin/firefox
hey if I click on this vegastrike file it starts the game but if I make a link to the desktop or main menu and click that it freezes and I have to reboot x any idea what the problem is
try cd ~/.Desktop; ln -s /path/to/file
or make a bash script to cd to the containing folder then run the file
I tried that not sure if I understand what your saying completely
cd ~/.Desktop; In -s /home/rfxcasey/Games/vegastrike/bin/vegastrike-64
bash: cd: /home/rfxcasey/.Desktop: No such file or directory
when I put in file vegastrike-64 I get this vegastrike-64: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), for GNU/Linux 2.6.8, dynamically linked (uses shared libs), not stripped
then its a binary
so why won't a link work on it? I can create working links for other files
would giving it a .bin extension help you think?
maybe it likes to be ran from the working directory, try editing your shortcut to specify the working directory
no, extensions mean very little in linux
Not sure I know what you mean about working directory. When I make a link it asks me to browse to the file and select it isn't that the working directory
the working directory is the folder the file is sat in
if you run a link to a file you are in the desktop folder
what else would a link contain? It is set to the working directory.
you could make a bash script to cd to the folder the binary is in then execute it
